specialities:
A Complete Top to Bottom Inspection of the Home - ​Roofs, Gutters & Downspouts, Vents, Chimneys, Basement, Foundation, Structure, Drainage, Attics, Insulation & Ventilation, Flashings, Valleys, Eaves, Soffit & Fascia, Windows & Doors, Floors, Walls & Ceilings, Brick, Siding & Stucco, Decks, Porches, Garages, Driveways, Heating & Cooling, Plumbing & Electrical.  Thermal Imaging (Infrared Camera) is used for all inspections.

​

    Same Day Inspection Report - With the option of a PDF or web based report, you can view the report from anywhere using a laptop, tablet or smartphone.  The report contains colour photos of the defects, colour illustrations and the resulting recommendations.  The report also contains helpful links to online articles for your reference.


    ​​The Latest Home Inspection Technology ​- For home inspections we use the latest non-invasive technology, tools and instruments, including Thermal Imaging, SpectoScope, Moisture Meter, Combustible Gas Detector, Laser Thermometer, Hygrometer, Boroscope, Electrical Testers, Voltage Detectors among other tools. We inspect all major components of the home from the exterior to the interior.


    ​A Home Inspection Reference Book - "Now That You Have Had a Home Inspection" is a book that is provided to you upon completion of the inspection.  This book contains helpful tips on maintaining your home, saving energy and how your home works.  This book is an excellent source of helpful information for experienced home owners and first time buyers.

​

    Lab Results Obtained the Next Day - A detailed lab report is provided the next day for Mold Inspections.  In addition to taking mold samples for laboratory analysis, we also do Indoor Air Quality Testing to check for the presence of mold spores in the air.  Samples are sent to our PRO-LAB partners in Vaughan and samples are analyzed for the presence of mold, lead or asbestos.  The lab report details the species of mold, the spore concentration and any known health problems or allergic reactions that may be associated with the mold.   Some people have allergies to pets such as dogs and cats, while others have allergies or concerns about cockroaches, rats, mice and dust mites.  Did you know we also test the air for allergens?  Contact us​ for more details.

​

    ​A Certified Home and Mold Inspector ​- You will have an inspection conducted by a qualified and certified inspector who is trained and experienced in finding defects that may require repairs in the future.  Your inspector will provide unmatched service and gives his full attention to you and the home inspection and answering all of your questions.

​

    Support After Moving In ​- We take pride in providing support to clients after they take possession of their home.  We are only a phone call away to answer any of your questions.  To us, servicing a client is more than just a transaction, rather its an enjoyable overall experience.​

Equipped with the latest FLIR Infrared Camera.  25 years experience. 
Make the right decision in your biggest life investment.  Let me be your eyes and ears! 

We provide home inspections for buyers, sellers, and owners. Our primary goal is to acquire and retain satisfied customers by placing their concerns foremost. For our home-buying clients, we want to help them make a well-informed decision about one of their most important investments. To achieve this, we aim to put in proper perspective everything we call out so that serious items are highlighted and routine items do not cause undue alarm. For our home-selling clients, we want to help them present their house in the best possible light. Our pre-listing report identifies areas to be addressed ahead of time, and it can also be shown to prospective buyers as a way to assure them that there aren't any hidden surprises.

We are very thorough and do not cut corners. We tend to spend more time at the site than our competitors. Our reports are also thorough and complete, with clear and extensive details. We like to think of our reports as a kind of owner's manual for your home.

You can count on us to be professional, courteous, and open-minded; to pay meticulous attention to detail; to display a calm demeanor, a high standard of integrity, and a spirit of fairness; and to listen carefully to the client's concerns. 


An infrared thermal imaging inspection can identify and document:
•	Energy loss and efficiency 
•	Unknown plumbing leaks 
•	Hidden roof leaks, before they cause serious damage 
•	Electrical faults before they cause a fire 
•	Overloaded and undersized circuits 
•	Circuit breakers in need of immediate replacement 
•	Missing, damaged, and/or wet insulation 
•	Heat loss and air infiltration in walls, ceilings, floors, windows and doors 
•	Water and moisture intrusion that could lead to mold 
•	Possible rodent or pest infestation 
•	Air conditioner compressor leaks 
•	Under fastening and/or missing framing members 
•	Structural defects 
•	Broken seals in double pane windows 
•	Dangerous fluid leaks 
•	Damaged and/or malfunctioning radiant heating systems 
•	Overheated equipment 
Use your infrared home inspection for:
•	pre-purchase 
•	Warranty Inspections 
•	Renovation Inspections: Pre and Post 
•	construction phase inspections 
•	locating missing, damaged and wet insulation 
•	moisture, electrical, mechanical, and roof inspections 
•	assessment of your homes health - Do you have mold? 
•	to improve your homes efficiency, performance and its personal comfort
A typical  Themal Home Inspection on a 2000 sq. ft. home usually takes about 1 hour minimum. This includes the actual thermal scan, obtaining both... the Infrared and digital images, then carefully interpreting and explaining our findings to you. You also have this time to consult with us as to "How you can properly correct deficiencies that are located with the thermal Imaging". Then all of the thermal images will be compiled into a professional and detailed report and emailed to you within 3  5 business days.
